entry.title: SAP VENDOR MASTER UPLOADER.
entry.content:
Hi all,

I want to create SAP VENDOR MASTER uploader by calling BAPI, I did

What to do next to fill rest of the fields for GENERAL, COMPANY CODE and PURCHASING TAB data, Like Reconcilliation account , legal, bank details, payment term, SCHEMA GROUP, CURRENCY etc.

Please help here!

entry.title: CDS for Business Partner International address version
entry.content:
Do you know any CDS which could be use to get  Business Partner International address version? CDS like I_Address or I_Address_2 always take only default address version (adcp.nation = ' ').  Do you know why is like this? It's on purpose?
For Chinese client I need provide some report which includes among others BP address in both version: default and local one.
Of course I can create own CDS based on table but the question is why standard doesn't provide such solution?

entry.title: Automatic Clarifications – Adjusting SELW1 and SELT1 fields
entry.content:
Hello,

We are working with a public sector client whose system records incoming payments before registering the corresponding debt. As a result, the payment remains in clarification status (transaction FPCPL) until the debt document is generated (FI-CA), at which point reconciliation can occur.

To automate this process, we need to implement a custom program that can identify the corresponding document number (DFKKOP-OPBEL) for each incoming payment in clarification and populate this number into the SELW1 and SELT1 fields of each record in the income clarification tables DFKKZP and DFKKCFZST.

Do you know if there is a standard way to update these values? Is there a function module available that performs this task?

This would allow us to execute automatic clarification in the background, passing the necessary information for the SELW1 and SELT1 fields (DFKKZP and DFKKCFZST) into the located record (I_POSZA) of the batch (I_KEYZ1).

Your help would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: How to use SAP hana-client module with Vite / SvelteKit?
entry.content:
Hi all,

I've been trying to use @SAP/hana-client module on a SvelteKit project (which bundles everything using Vite). With default configs, it runs fine on dev mode (no SSR/prerendering). However, when trying to build the app, it throws an exception trying to prerender the binary blobs, which is expected. When instructing Vite not to prerender the lib, there are errors on the import, as it is a CommonJS module and was not "ESM-ized" by Vite build process. We then need to import it as "import * as hana from (...)" instead of "import hana from (...)", as it says the module doesn't have a default export, which makes the app finally build, but then breaks the dev mode, because createPool() is now undiscoverable in ESM mode. Also, dev mode only runs if the "ssr" config (see below) is not used, or else it gives an error trying to use require(), which is not defined on ESM mode.

Is there a way users are supposed to handle the combination of CommonJS + binary blobs? Are there plans of migrating the lib to standard ESM?

The Vite configs (vite.config.ts) used to ignore the module on prerendering are:

  ssr: {
    noExternal: ["@sap/hana-client"],
  },
  optimizeDeps: {
    exclude: ['@sap/hana-client']  // don't try to pre-bundle it
  },
  build: {
    rollupOptions: {
      plugins: [
        commonjs({
          ignoreDynamicRequires: true
        })
      ]
    }
  },

 Thanks in advance,
Lawisch

entry.title: Full Payment Submission Amendment reversal
entry.content:
Hi,

We have submitted an FPSA with the incorrect Payroll Period.  

How do we reverse this?  The FPSA was only to include Class 1A value on termination payments.  Is it correct that we submit an FPSA again, but this time with a -ve value of the class 1A, include the same payroll period?

Then, when we submit the FPSA again, use the correct Payroll Period and a +ve Class 1A value?

I remember from years ago, but perhaps it was an EYU that you placed an 'X' somewhere in the upload template and this reverses the submission?

Alex

entry.title: Fiscal Year and Posting Period
entry.content:
Suppose I am starting a company in mid of a month (suppose 15th April), for this can I restrict the user to not able to select any date before the 15th of April, since before that my organisation was not in existence. 
But whenever I am creating a fiscal year and posting period, I am making the full month open and not a part of it which is on the basis of date. So, is there any way to manage this scenario.

entry.title: SD Cancelling billing error due to deletion of Accounting assignment order
entry.content:
Hello Gurus,

we have a tricky situation. Our client has last year flagged one  Account Assignment order for deletion. Unfortunately , they figured out currently that they have one open bill assigned to that account. Now when they cancelled that bill,it failed to do reverse posting in FI as the account mentioned in that invoice does not exists. It is throwing  error : Order is flagged for deletion, either enter the different order or remove  the deletion flag.  Cleint does not want to remove the flag for deleteion and in change mode the Account Assignemnt order number is greyed out.

 I would like to know how can i change the order number in that bill ?

If changing the order number is not possible what other options are possible as in FBL5n customer is seeing as open item since FI posting is not reversed.?

Looking forward to hear from  you.

Thanking you all in advance.

Kind Regards

Reshu

entry.title: How can I retrieve through the Service Layer the quantity of items per batch in each warehouse?
entry.content:
Currently, I can only see the available batches and the total quantity of items per warehouse, but not the distribution of quantities per warehouse for each batch.

I have already tested the available endpoints and was not able to combine the information of batches with the available quantity per batch. Is there any path or call in the Service Layer that provides this information?

entry.title: GTS e4H: Incorrect Export and Shipping Date Assignment in Automatic GTS Document Creation (USA)
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I have the following problem – When an invoice from ERP is transferred to GTS for the USA, an export document is automatically created. That is correct so far. During this process, the registration date, export date, and shipping date are set. The registration date is correct, but the export date is incorrectly set to several days in the past with a timestamp of 00:00:00 EST. That is wrong. The export date must not be earlier than the registration date and must not have a zero timestamp. The shipping date is also set to the export date and is therefore equally incorrect. The FTO and the SIT are in the same time zone. If I manually create an export declaration for the USA with the same data, the date and timestamp are correct. Where could I look for the error? Has anyone experienced this before? 🙂 I would appreciate any tips.

Best Wishes

entry.title: Run and monitor replication tasks in Business Application Studio (BAS)
entry.content:
Hi,

I successfully  created a replication task in Business Application Studio following https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/real-time-replication-task-using-sap-business-application-studio/ba-p/13515467  and the replication task has been deployed to an on-premise HANA DB. Now I'm struggling with running and monitoring the execution of the replication task.

When I Execute Replication Task from context menu

I find following messages in the output but the activity never finishes and the target table is not being populated.

If I run the very same statement 'call myReplicationTask.START_REPLICATION' in the SQL console of my HDI container, everything works as expected, i.e. I find all relevant data in the target table and inserts / updates are also propagated to my HANA DB.

Also the Task Monitor for Replication Task doesn't work for me

First I receive following error although I'm still connected to cloud foundry according to the cf login page.

then I'm asked  to add the database to the Database Explorer.

But I neither can select the HDI Container

nor can connect with instance type SAP HANA Database

 

So my questions are

  1. Are the context menu functions such as Execute Replication Task or Lauch Task Monitor for Replication Task designed for HANA Cloud only or should this work with on-prem db as well?
  2. What might be missing in the configuration?  Which logs might be worth checking?

entry.title: Exclusion Pattern for Data Provisioning Agent (DP Agent) File Adapter Configuration File
entry.content:
Hi All!

We are trying to set a filename pattern in the Data Provisioning Agent File Adapter configuration file, but we would need to exclude a specific filename that satisfies the said pattern.

For example, we are trying to set the pattern as: "FORCE_FILENAME_PATTERN=%_TEST_FILE_%.txt", but we only need to exclude "FINAL_TEST_FILE_%.txt" specifically.

Is it possible to add some kind of exclusion mask in the DP Agent File Adapter Configuration File or any other option so we could achieve this?

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Top 25 SAP S/4HANA & ABAP Interview Questions and Answers (2025)
entry.content:
Preparing for a SAP ABAP or S/4HANA interview can feel overwhelming. You spend hours revising concepts, yet when the interview starts, the real challenge is remembering which questions are most commonly asked and how to answer them with clarity.

To help you overcome this, I’ve compiled the Top 25 SAP ABAP and S/4HANA Interview Questions for 2025—based on real-world interview experiences and what hiring managers actually look for.

This post curates the most common SAP ABAP & S/4HANA interview questions for 2025—spanning DDIC, ALV, BDC, CDS, AMDP, Open vs Native SQL, ABAP on HANA, Web Dynpro and more. For clear, step-by-step answers, watch the full breakdown here:
👉 Video: Top 25 SAP S/4HANA & ABAP Interview Questions and Answers (2025)

📌 Top 25 SAP ABAP & S/4HANA Interview Questions (2025)

  1. What is SAP ABAP?
  2. What is the ABAP Data Dictionary (DDIC)?
  3. Difference between transparent tables and pooled/cluster tables
  4. What are SmartForms and their benefits over SAP Scripts?
  5. Difference between function modules and BAPIs
  6. What is BDC (Batch Data Communication)? Methods: recording, session, call transaction
  7. What are modularization techniques in ABAP?
  8. Difference between Classical Reports, Interactive Reports, and ALV Reports
  9. What are field symbols and how are they used?
  10. How do you define and use internal tables?
  11. What are the basic data types in ABAP?
  12. What is ABAP Objects (OOP in ABAP)?
  13. Explain inheritance and polymorphism in ABAP Objects
  14. What is a Lock Object? How is locking handled in ABAP?
  15. Open SQL vs Native SQL – differences and use cases
  16. What are RICEFW objects in SAP projects?
  17. Explain CALL TRANSACTION and its use cases
  18. What are CDS Views and their significance in S/4HANA?
  19. What is AMDP (ABAP Managed Database Procedure) and why is it used?
  20. Debugging in ABAP – breakpoints, watchpoints, ST22 dumps
  21. What is Web Dynpro for ABAP?
  22. CDS vs AMDP vs Traditional Reports – when to use which?
  23. What are the key features of ABAP on HANA?
  24. What tools and T-codes are essential for ABAP development?
  25. What are type groups and their purpose in ABAP?

Why this matters in 2025 (How to Crack SAP ABAP Interview)

SAP technology continues to evolve, especially with ABAP on HANA and S/4HANA migrations. Interviewers are no longer just testing textbook knowledge—they want to see if you can connect concepts to real project scenarios. These 25 questions cover exactly that mix of fundamentals + modern ABAP practices.

📽️ For in-depth answers, examples, and explanations, check out the full video:
👉 Top 25 SAP ABAP & S/4HANA Interview Questions and Answers (2025)

💡 Tip: Don’t just memorize these questions—try to explain them in your own words, link them to project experience, and always be ready with a short example. That’s what makes you stand out in interviews.

entry.title: How to Prevent MRP from Covering Shortages Before the PIR Horizon
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am currently facing an issue in our company’s MRP SAP HANNA process (we are an e-commerce business that buys and sells products, with procurement only — no production).

When we run MRP, the system generates purchase requisitions not only for the PIR horizon we want to plan against, but also to cover shortages that occur before this horizon. These shortages usually happen because we oversell units, which consumes stock that was originally intended for the following months.

The result is that MRP creates purchase requisitions that do not align with our business strategy. What we really need is for MRP to generate purchase requisitions only based on the PIRs within the future planning horizon, while ignoring earlier shortages that cannot realistically be covered and are not relevant for our replenishment strategy.

We are already using horizon planning (MRP type M3 with firming type 4), and we also tried applying a time fence, but the Planned Independent Requirements (PIRs) are still being reduced by these earlier shortages. The system continues to generate purchase requisitions as if it needs to cover those intermediate gaps, instead of focusing on the intended future horizon.

What we are looking for:
Guidance on how to configure MRP so that purchase requisitions are aligned only with the future PIR horizon, without being influenced by shortages caused by overselling in earlier periods.

Could you kindly advise if there is a standard configuration, BAdI, or best practice that can help us achieve this? Any insights or recommendations would be highly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your support!

entry.title: Configuration of transaction F.19 GRIR with regard to specific information needed
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

in an S4 HANA transformation we are testing transaction F.19 as part of GR/IR reconcilation.  When I chose parameters and execute in new S4 system, I got less informationen compared to old r3 system (please see screenshots attached). So, the information such as account assignment, network, network activity, profit center and user who created the purchase order is missing.

Do you have any advice how to get this informationen included into the analysis or is this not SAP standard? 

Thank you in advance

Kind regards

Jonas
